Name: ft.per.m
Description or rationale: Imperial to SI units

Name: cm.per.in
Description or rationale: Imperial to SI units

Name: m.per.km
Description or rationale: Scale adjustment factor

Name: cm.per.m
Description or rationale: Scale adjustment factor

Name: m2.per.ha
Description or rationale: Scale adjustment factor

Name: kg.per.Mg
Description or rationale: Scale adjustment factor

Name: live.tree.C.content
Description or rationale: Average stem tissue C concentration of 48.0% for temperate deciduous forests
Reference: Table 4.3 in IPCC. 2006. 2006 IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories. ISBN 4-88788-032-4. Institute for Global Environmental Strategies.

Name: fwd.C.content
Description or rationale: Averaged from measured C concentration of small fine woody debris (<2.5 cm)

Name: C1
Description or rationale: Constant in equation for coarse and fine woody debris volume to get estimate in metric units (m3/ha)
Reference: Equations (1) and (5) in Woodall, Christopher W., Vicente J. Monleon, Shawn Fraver, et al. 2019. “The Downed and Dead Wood Inventory of Forests in the United States.” Scientific Data 6 (1): 1. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2018.303.

Name: cwd.C.content
Description or rationale: Carbon concentration of downed angiosperms in decay class 3
Reference: Table 3 in Harmon, Mark E., Becky Fasth, Christopher W. Woodall, and Jay Sexton. 2013. “Carbon Concentration of Standing and Downed Woody Detritus: Effects of Tree Taxa, Decay Class, Position, and Tissue Type.” Forest Ecology and Management 291: 259–67. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2012.11.046. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2012.11.046.

Name: cwd.wood.density
Description or rationale: Wood density of downed angiosperms in decay class 3
Reference: Table 4 in Harmon, Mark E., Christopher W. Woodall, Becky Fasth, Jay Sexton, and Misha. Yatkov. 2011. Differences between Standing and Downed Dead Tree Wood Density Reduction Factors: A Comparison across Decay Classes and Tree Species. NRS-RP-15. U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service, Northern Research Station. https://doi.org/10.2737/NRS-RP-15.

Name: snag.C.content
Description or rationale: Carbon concentration of standing dead angiosperms in decay class 3
Reference: Table 3 in Harmon, Mark E., Becky Fasth, Christopher W. Woodall, and Jay Sexton. 2013. “Carbon Concentration of Standing and Downed Woody Detritus: Effects of Tree Taxa, Decay Class, Position, and Tissue Type.” Forest Ecology and Management 291: 259–67. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2012.11.046.67. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foreco.2012.11.046.

Name: snag.wood.density
Description or rationale: Wood density of standing dead angiosperms in decay class 3
Reference: Table 4 in Harmon, Mark E., Christopher W. Woodall, Becky Fasth, Jay Sexton, and Misha. Yatkov. 2011. Differences between Standing and Downed Dead Tree Wood Density Reduction Factors: A Comparison across Decay Classes and Tree Species. NRS-RP-15. U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service, Northern Research Station. https://doi.org/10.2737/NRS-RP-15.

Name: min.snag.height.ft
Description or rationale: Breast height, which is the minimum height threshold for recording standing dead tree diameters (>= 2.5 cm) and stem counts (<2.5 cm)

Name: median.stem.diameter.cm
Description or rationale: Median diameter of potential range for all stem counts (<2.5 cm)

Name: median.int.fwd.diameter.cm
Description or rationale: Median diameter of potential range for all intermediate fine woody debris counts (>=2.5 cm, <7.6 cm)

Name: plot.length.m
Description or rationale: Woody plot length in SI units

Name: plot.width.m
Description or rationale: Woody plot width in SI units

Name: plot.area.m2
Description or rationale: Woody plot area in SI units

Name: plot.area.ha
Description or rationale: Woody plot area in standard unit for carbon stocks (hectares)

Name: plot.length.ft
Description or rationale: Woody plot length in imperial units, which is needed for the coarse and fine woody debris volume calculations

Name: auger.depth
Description or rationale: Depth of auger sample taken from each 1-m2 quadrat

Name: longitude
Description or rationale: Experimental site location (longitude) using WGS1984 coordinate system

Name: latitude
Description or rationale: Experimental site location (latitude) using WGS1984 coordinate system
